title: Not  a fan of the new masteries
body:
Riot dumbed down the masteries big time. They also took away the uniqueness a summoner could spec their champion. Say, if I wanted to put all 30 points in Resolve for as much tankiness as possible. It will not let me, It makes me split points to only have put 18 in one row. That is not how I want to play my champions.  Then being forced to take 2 options that I do not want, I neither want to move 12% in brush and river nor do I want 2 less damage from champions and minion.......This is not how I want to play my champion, this does not benefit my playstyle for whichever champ I choose. 

They also combine a lot old mastery abilities together. In the Ferocity line, if your damage scales only off of AD, you will be getting split abilities with both AD and AP. How does this define your roll if Riot has made it so you only have 2 chooses? They no longer let you choose the path you want for your champion, it is chosen for you. A or B

replies.body:
"Oh but they're going to make each champion feel unique guys." 

 No, these are lazy cookie-cutter masteries like Blizzard loves to use now. I used to have 20 pages for specific champions, and now I can solve everything with 9. What's worse is that I doubt 3 of them are even viable.

Yeah I'm sure feeling the meaningful choices here.
This is honestly the real problem I used to have separate pages for some of my adcs but now they all fall under one page. Honestly at this point all you need is 10 pages.
The previous masteries were cookie cutter masteries.
Do you even understand what "cookie-cutter" means?

http://wowwiki.wikia.com/wiki/Cookie_cutter

This definition represents how I describe them. 

The previous Masteries were exactly like the talents system in World of Warcraft before switching to talents 2.0. They were just small things that stacked up as you leveled. It also felt very boring since people tended to look up what the best players picked. 

Why I don't think the new ones are cookie cutters is because of the keystone Masteries, which give the option of choice in your final bonus to fit your playstyle. Rather than just a capstone. 

What are cookie cutter builds to you?

Yea, I quit WoW in no small part due to the mastery system getting worse and worse, more dumbed down and more constrained. I hate this new system. I'm still not sure what to with all the time, but, even worse, it seems like no matter what I do I feel like I'm missing out on something huge somewhere else. I was told that this new system would be rewarding. Now when I'm taking not capstone talents It feels like I'm doing some mix of accounting and balancing scales, never really happy with my choice or my process (Like, I want Mana Regen and Most Dangerous Game, I Was both Tier 1 Ferocity Talents, I sued to be able to have something close to that). And, when I get to capstones, I'm either choosing something I don't give a damn about (Mana biscuits, whoopie) or I feel like I'm making the wrong choice and one of the other two would be so much better. I seriously hate this new mastery system.
Ghostcrawler was the lead dev at Blizzard when the talent 'streamlining' went through.  Now he's here doing the same thing.  What did you think was gonna happen, this has GC all over it.

Your right. Being forced into either column A or column B, with no possibility of picking C is pretty lame and cookie cutter. Think about it like this. What yasuo player would want to take the 'Natural Talent' in the ferocity tree that also grants you 10 AD and 15 AP at lvl 18. Atleast before this update, you had a choice of what to go with, even if it wasn't optimal.

I don't know how diversity can be a buzzword for Riot when they do something like
-Remove half the masteries
-Throw the rest into a blender and see what tree they come out in
-Make everyone feel obliged to take an 18 point mastery
-Force a 50/50 choice on each step of the way to the 18 point
sidenote: of the 50/50 choices, half will feel like both choices are useless, the other half will make you want to choose both. Surprise! You can only choose 1! But you have to!

Maybe I was unusual, but in S5 I had about 10 pages and only 4-5 of them had a 21 point. Now its like, get ready for league of 18/12/0 (with occasional weirdoes doing 18/6/6)

The 'forced to take masteries I don't want' hits hard.

Maybe I want to put more points into Cunning, instead of having to spend it elsewhere that I don't really care for because I can't have points unspent right?

This season just makes me feel like all my choices are being taken away, and that I have to play Riot's way.

And if you're ad or auto-attack oriented at all, you're at a serious disadvantage if you don't take Warlord's Bloodlust.

The keystones were a nice unique addition to the mastery page. They could have kept masteries the way they were with a little modifying (taking out un-used abilities and adding new ones) while still keeping a level of different layouts for your champ. The keystone would be where your champion truly becomes impactful to the game. 

Like I said keystones are a really cool idea to introduce to the game.  So you could choose to spec your champ the way you want to.

It's simpler, but that means there is less diversity.  Sure, it cuts down on the number of mastery pages. I don't like the new point system (18 and 12 is a pretty strange way to balance it out)

I hate how you have to choose between two talents every other one.

Also it benefits ad champs so much better than ap champs, looking into the ferocity tree,  you can have scaling ap and ad or spell vamp and life steal? 
What happened to the flat ap that midlaners get?

Crit strikes that heal you for 15% of dmg dealt and 20% increased atk spd with just a 2 second cd???

Ap items already got nerfed and increased cost. Ap mids are losing so much power with hardly any compensation of the removal of the previous masteries.

It also frustrates me that there are Keystones that are clearly AD-only: Warlord's and Fervor, for example. There are **none** that are AP-only. There's a bonus AD ratio on Deathfire and Thunderlord (in both cases higher than the AP ratio even!), Stormraider's doesn't care if you're AD or AP.

I actually agree with Riot that fewer, more impactful masteries promote making meaningful decisions that distinctly affect how one plays their Champion. There are a few minor grievances I have, but I believe it's a much better system than what was previously in use.

Yes, but when you require people to choose one of two masteries that don't fit with a certain play style (such as Runic Affinity or Secret Stash for an ADC trying to get Merciless), you know you've messed up in some significant style. The old masteries were very nice. Sure, masteries were very similar between two characters of the same type, but they could have more focus into one style. This one mixes those into different categories now. I can no longer get _only_ the bonuses I want. I have to settle for bonuses I _don't_ want, and then I can choose between bonuses that I could have had together in equal strength before this update, but am now forced to spec mostly into one or the other (a 3/2 split is still a split).

You perfectly explained one of the issues I have with the system. However, I like that these Masteries can really be felt in the way a Champion is played. Previously you had a nice selection of small bonuses that didn't feel too impactful; they were just taken for granted.

I fundamentally disagree with your position.

Having a large number of smaller bonuses to choose from, it is much more likely that you can make a rune page particular to your champions needs - by locking the masteries to a small number of very powerful masteries, you instead force people into very broad choices where there might be only one good option, preceded by NO good options, or worse have multiple good options that you're not allowed to choose from. 

The only added choice the new mastery system provides is in what nodes you don't want to spend points on that you feel suck the least.

Again, this is one of the issues I have with the new system, but I find it preferable to the old system. When using the old system, the Masteries were more tailored to each individual Champion but they were almost completely unnoticeable. I like the idea of making meaningful choices to cement a particular style of play for your Champion. Unfortunately, the best way Riot could design to promote those meaningful decisions was to force people into mastery paths that they really don't want or need. Having only two decisions per tier really limits what can be accomplished.

But let's not pretend the old masteries were significantly more diverse. Changes between Champion's pages were often one to two Masteris worth of points at best and that has remained relatively the same from what I've seen so far,

This is an understandable position.

Certainly there weren't any single "OMG THIS IS SO WOW" masteries in the old system, and each individual node was rather small as a bonus, but there was real power in the "sum of parts" that you could make up with the old mastery system. Most importantly was that, even though the bonuses were small, the points spent on them felt good and worthwhile: +movement speed, 5% cooldown reduction, tenacity, biscuits, summoners spell cooldowns, while small bonuses all, they were cheap to acquire and they felt good for their cost - I never felt like I "wasted" points going for something, and I had masteries split across the 3 trees for multiple champs. In other cases I devoted all or almost all of the points into a single tree for certain applications (like the Taric super tank block, or my Hybrid damage tree), and fiddling with the nodes was very fun for me.

The current nodes you put points into are split into 5 point nodes and endpoints, but the 5 pointers are completely unsatisfying; they're balanced entirely around putting all 5 points into them, and they each provide very small bonuses for their point value far worse than in the old tree. Everything in the first 2 tiers is almost completely ignorable and there's no way to just do a "small dip" into a tree to pick something you like, you have to invest a minimum of 6 points, because putting one point into any of the skills is total crap. The current mastery trees are simply "pick one of the top 9 masteries you feel is best and fill out the often undestirable prerequisites in order to acquire it" followed by investing points into stuff you absolutely don't want. And the masteries that are available just feel so pigeonholey - like a tank would not want both health regen AND armor or tenacity AND resistances; and I don't even know how to do certain things in the tree like make a hybrid path (that is a path for a hybrid build, not a even split between two trees, although the way they're set up requiring point expenditures in multiples of 6 screws that up also.

Even within those end cap masteries, I will admit I've not tested them all yet, but the only ones I've really _felt_ the impact of are Warlords Bloodlust and Grasp of the Undying.

You know I like you. Even though we are differing in opinion, you make a good case and aren't rude.

I completely understand where you're coming from and to each their own! At the very least, I think we can both agree that we hope Riot makes some adjustments before Season 6 comes around. 

I also had a pleasant time discussing masteries with you! :)

I know how you feel.


the CDR mastery is in the middle of the cunning tree

I use 15% cdr runes with Shaco

i f*cking need my last 5% yet i can't use it..

I was so mad when i found out about that..

I'll personally have to try them out but I like the direction they're taking it. The old mastery tree had a lot of fluff and frankly I felt like there was mostly the illusion of a lot of choice.

 If you were AP you took 21 points on the left hand side of the offense tree, if you were ad you took 21 points into the right had side, and sometimes a champ would take spell-weaving/blade weaving if they used a lot of aa's and abilities. Unless you were a squishy support or ryze you'd never go 21 in utility and tank's 21st mastery felt awful compared to what offense had to offer. 

you say there's less choice but frankly I feel like there can be a lot of variety, I was thinking perhaps taking thunderlord's decree with luden's echo spammy mages, or deathfire touch for liandry's mages, bruisers can use like 7 of the final keystone masteries and offensive champions can viably build into the utility tree which I honestly find awesome. 

The only gripe I have is no gimmicky all offense for the kayles or all defense for the malphites, I agree with you there, but I like it as a whole.
Sorry, which ones are viable on bruisers? Bruisers don't build AP or crit, and don't want to redirect damage to themselves, which removes basically all of them.

depends on the bruiser, renekton could use any of the defensive masteries or thunderlord's or deathfire's touch for harass (5), depending on what stats you value more in the deeper portion of the tree. Any bruiser with built in sustain could potentially go windspeaker's blessing to become more of a drain tank (assuming it works on yourself if so, 6). Auto attack heavy ones like xin or vi could go fervor of battle (7). 

Also I'd imagine hecarim would enjoy any of the defensive masteries or stormraider's surge. Bruiser is a bit broad, perhaps not every bruiser can use every keystone listed, but most bruiser can certainly use more than 1 depending on the situation or matchup. 

Like I said I need to actually test all of these, but on the surface there's so much more potential than 15% bonus damage or 15... flat armor/mr (really?), that I'm excited for the changes.

I quit WoW because of masteries systems like the one implemented.

Under the old tree, I always felt like a 1) Was able to do what was optimal and 2) Had the freedom to place points where I needed. I feel constrained by the new trees, and, unlike in the old system I where I always went in to a game feeling I had the best mastery set up, I always feel like I didn't take the most effective masteries and wonder if I shouldve went with another tree for another capstone. Hate this system.

They did simplify the masteries, but the old masteries were never about customization or adjusting your stats to your playstyle. They were about squeezing as much as possible out of the small benefits they provided.

I absolutley agree. Even thought I am Bronze for Life these new masteries are horrible. It is exactly what Blizzard did during Panda and I hated it and left the game.

I am lookin at this now and im like WTF! I can understand not taking 2 Keystones and I like the idea of them, but I should not be forced into option  A or B on regular stats. 

The greatest thing about talent trees is that its a TREE! Not a twig with a nub. You can customize how you want and that is why Path of Exile is so diverse, infact it might be a lil overboard but it still leaves room.

Games with Talent Trees should be complicated and Diverse otherwise why have them if the company thinks your too stupid to know how to create and build a character in their own game.

Bleh I dont know, I dont like it. Maybe its time to move on.
They changed them during Cataclysm

I stand corrected. thankyou 
Cataclysm brought in specialzed talent trees with 31pts insteasd of the classic 41pt tree
MOP removed all of that entirely in which is what I originally meant.
I also had 20 mastery pages and found myself sadly deleting all of them today for 5. All of the hours, sweat and tears I poured into making my mastery pages perfect for my champions ;~;

I think the new masteries are much better primarily because everyone is acting like the old trees had so many options.

They had more possibilities to spread out the points, but if you were AD you knew exactly what you were talking (everything on the left side of offense) and if you were AP then the other half (everything on the right side).

Also, the old last point in offense had to be most boring choice ever.  It was a flat damage boost that you were inevitably going to take no matter what as long as you were already 20 points in with 1 to go.  

Whatever everyone on here says the old trees were not better.  Keystones at least drastically affect your game play in their own way.  They could still use some perfecting (like adding more tiers or allowing you to put points in any spot, so you could go like 30/0/0 or 9/9/12), but they definitely change the way you play the game and actually to some degree balance out characters and give classes new opportunities.

Death fire touch and grasp of the undying has been some of the two best masteries I have ever used after trying them out today.  Grasp of the undying is the single best tank mastery ever IMO.

Experiment with the new stuff before writing long complaint posts.

You are still going down either the left side(AD or the right side(AP), it is just that the right side now gives both AD and AP. It is a waste of utility. When have you every played a pure mage and needed AD for your spells? 

The old masteries you could pick both Double Edge Sword and Feast, now you can not. It is either one or the other. With the old masteries you could   put full points into Vampirism and choose between either AD per lvl or AP per lvl. Now you can not. 

Both masteries changed they way the you played the game, both masteries balanced out characters to some degree and gave classes new opporunities. Why? Because they both use the exact same abilities (except for keystones). It is just now you can only choose one of two ways. 

Now, the keystones were a nice addition to the mastery page, some of them have been very useful. I never said that they were not, I am just upset that I lost my choice on how to spec my masteries the way I wanted to.

I hate the "AD and AP per level" so much. As a mage, the only time I would like AD is early game so I can CS better, and the mastery is useless for that (less than 1 AD at level 1?). As Vayne or Cait, I don't want AP at all.

As a mage, I feel like that a lot. It feels like there is absolutely nothing for just mages anymore, even though there are a ton of masteries that are JUST for AD champions. Sure, mages can take Deathfire, but it also has an AD ratio and benefits AD casters like Urgot. We can grab AP per level but it comes with AD per level. We can get flat mpen but it comes with flat arpen. Burst AP mages can take Stormraider or Thunderlord, but so can AD assassins or auto-attackers.

Plain and simple with the new masteries, you have to take what you do not want. Best example is in the Cunning tree, between Runic Affinity(RA) and Secret Stash(SS). If you are not a jungler why take RA or if you are not a support why take SS. But then again why take SS at all with the new pots and health pots costing 50g now.

If you're an ADC and you're investing to get Merciless, why not take Runic Affinity? It gives you longer uptime on your Baron buff, Dragon buff and even your Red buff (which you should get later on in the game).

On the other side, Secret Stash makes you get more out of your HP potions in lane.

Mere seconds on both of those, also read on LoL wiki that RA does not work on Baron buff. That is what I am trying to get at, I do not like those masteries, but yet I am forced to take one if I wish to get a keystone in Cunning.

I would just like to say that I would agree, masteries feel very limited, a step backward in my opinion. The customization for each champion was far better with the old masteries. Big thumbs down riot sorry.

yea i dont approve with the new mastery tree either.. ive been playing this game since before it came out on dota, i know what abilites contribute enough to use them, however with the new tree, ive gone from the 13 pages i use - 3 for specific roles, 6 for my mains and others for those off chance choices - to feeling like its not even worth using more then 2 pages. most the choices im forced to take have no baring on my builds.

also since LoL's release i feel riot has been making it more difficult for individuals to be unique with their style, this is by far the biggest blow for us to be most effective in the arena with our own individual style of play..

Allow me to preface this by saying I'm not trying to insult you or anything, but I really don't think you "know what abilities contribute enough to use them". A quick look at your match history shows that you don't use flash, upgrade your trinket, or build in a way that I wouldn't consider very, very odd. You also may be a bit out of sync with the game because in the last 7 and a half months you have played 20 games. 4 of them being today. I understand you have around 4,000 games played probably, ~1750 normals wins and 348 ranked games, but the game does change over time.

Further on, I know mastery score doesn't show much, but it does show how many champions you play, and how varied you are. With a score of 68, and 25 of that being on only 8 champions, assuming you have another 25-30 or so on the champions I can't see, that is only 38 champions. Around a third of the roster.

Moving on to item choices, you are running Talisman of Ascension Sivir, which is nice and all, but not optimal. You seem to buy a few BF Swords before you start upgrading also, lowering your credibility on the topic of knowing what contributes enough.

The most similar thing to Masteries are Runes, and I took a look there as well. On your "dps" page I couldn't hope but notice the 6% XP Bonus quints, Nor the GP10 seals. You have hybrid pen on an "apc" page. I don't see how that page is even for an "apc", there is no ap on it. Your "tank" page seems like it is more health regen than tank. 33 hp5 at level 18, and 2.4 hp5 are kinda... odd. And your choice of marks is odd. They dont seem to be visible......

Again, not tying to insult you, it is just that your credibility seems rather low. Also, you only have 4 games on the new patch.

[6 of their last 20 games here for reference.](http://puu.sh/lj1LG/2847dd8a0d.jpg)
["dps" Rune Page.](http://puu.sh/lj2K9/9ea564a503.jpg)

*_Notice how at no point their KDA nor their rank was mentioned. Those are not good stats to use, please don't use them._
The new masteries are a good step in the right direction but they need some improvement I liked putting All my points into one tree since my pure support tanks loved it.

I like that the new mastery effects are more dramatic. It feels like for each champion I make two or three important mastery decisions, whereas before it felt like I was making a bunch of almost insigificant decisions. Im still not sure about the keystone masteries. They are cool, but it seems like some are clearly better than others.

Dumbed them down and took away unique choices? That's...the opposite of what happened. Masteries now require you to make choices, rather than being a buffet of free stats. A or B is a choice. A and B is not.

It makes you pick between choice A and B. Then to make matters worse (in some cases) you have to choose between only two choice, and maybe you do not want either of those. But you have to take one of them to get the better masteries further down the tree.  Two choices, that is all you get. A and B gave you a third choice, choice C.

Don't act like you never had to take masteries you didn't want in order to unlock better ones in the old system. The better ones required a minimum number of points in their tree before you could take them. Having to pick masteries you don't want in order to get the ones you do want is not a new thing.
As an ADC or a APC under the old masteries, which one were you forced to take?
To take the last mastery in any tree, you had to have 20 others from that tree. That never forced you to take one you didn't want?
I disagree. I feel the changes this season are for the better, that`s what they`re trying to do and I see them pushing in that direction.

Yes, but how viable is your 30 points in a single tree in high level games?


Its not, quite frankly.
That depends entirely on what champion you are using. Taric gets very little benefit from other trees, compared to what he got from a full defensive mastery page.
I don't like the new masteries - can no more make then specific for a champ according to the way I am playing
